page.title: 10Farming in the Aboyne Area
page.content: The{farming}of the area is based on the production of{beef cattle.} The {crops}which are grown are mainly for winter feeding of livestock. Potatoes are grown for human consumption. There is also some commercial forestry, this has increased in the past few years, some areas not being shown on the map. Many of the farms and steadings are very old. A typical example of a farm in the area is Rosehill Farm. The farmhouse and steadings are at 541997. The farm has 44 hectares. 24 of arable land where barley, oats, turnips, potatoes and grass, for hay and silage, are grown. The other 20 hectares are rough{pasture}used for grazing cattle and shooting. The steadings, which are quite old, are used for storing winter feed. The cattle are sold at the Aboyne or Aberdeen marts for meat.
